summary: An offwhite version of the baycomb colorscheme, influenced by TaQua
name: bayQua
description:
An offwhite version of baycomb.vim, with subtle background shading on syntax.
This is basically a mix between my latest colorscheme, baycomb, and TaQua, by Eustaquio Rangel de Oliveira Jr. 

White backgrounds make it harder for me to identify normal text, and it seems harder to identify colors than on a dark background, so I added the soft glowing colors to syntax background. They may or may not be visible on your computer (they are too light to see on my computer at work; i adjusted them to be darker but then they were too dark and overpowering on my home computer).

The scheme has highlighting for both the GUI and Terminal. For tips and more information, go to baycomb's site:

baycomb: http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=1454
TaQua: http://www.vim.org/scripts/script.php?script_id=594

                                                                                 _______________
     Comments and suggestions:                    ***| axs221@gmail.com | ***
                                                                                 ---------------------------
install_details:
If the grey terminal background is too dark, try white (add to vimrc or baqua.vim):
   hi Normal ctermbg=white

Try bolding Identifiers if, for example, you'd like to easily spot where tags close in HTML
   hi Identifier gui=bold

versions.release_notes: Updated Terminal colors to better match the GUI. Colors now look almost exactly like the GUI (on my Windows Console atleast).
Fixed Underlined to be readable, and made a few adjustments.
Updated terminal colors, now featuring a dark grey background and adjusted values for terminal colors to be visible on new light bg.
